channel.title: attack.execution on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.execution on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious WMI Execution Using Rundll32
item.description: Detects WMI executing rundll32

item.title: Snatch Ransomware
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Snatch ransomware word document droppers

item.title: DNS RCE CVE-2020-1350
item.description: Detects exploitation of DNS RCE bug reported in CVE-2020-1350 by the detection of suspicious sub process

item.title: PSExec and WMI Process Creations Block
item.description: Detects blocking of process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands

item.title: File Was Not Allowed To Run
item.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.

item.title: Space After Filename
item.description: Detects space after filename

item.title: Suspicious XOR Encoded PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell process which includes bxor command, alternative obfuscation method to b64 encoded commands.

item.title: Cmd.exe CommandLine Path Traversal
item.description: detects the usage of path traversal in cmd.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

item.title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048

item.title: Notepad Making Network Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious network connection by Notepad

item.title: Maze Ransomware
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Maze ransomware word document droppers

item.title: PowerShell Create Local User
item.description: Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell

item.title: WMImplant Hack Tool
item.description: Detects parameters used by WMImplant

item.title: PowerShell DownloadFile
item.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

item.title: Exploited CVE-2020-10189 Zoho ManageEngine
item.description: Detects the exploitation of Zoho ManageEngine Desktop Central Java Deserialization vulnerability reported as CVE-2020-10189

item.title: Active Directory Kerberos DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects Kerberos DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: Active Directory Parsing DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects DSParse DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: CLR DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: dotNET DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects any assembly DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: GAC DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
item.description: Detects any GAC DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.title: VBA DLL Loaded Via Microsoft Word
item.description: Detects DLL’s Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros

item.title: Koadic Execution
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Koadic hack tool

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: Audit CVE Event
item.description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability (e.g. CVE-2020-0601)

item.title: Tasks Folder Evasion
item.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

item.title: Windows Mangement Instrumentation DLL Loaded Via Microsoft Word
item.description: Detects DLL’s Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros Executing WMI Commands

item.title: Operation Wocao Activity
item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.title: Bloodhound and Sharphound Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

item.title: Silence.EDA Detection
item.description: Detects Silence empireDNSagent

item.title: Exploiting SetupComplete.cmd CVE-2019-1378
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt of privilege escalation vulnerability via SetupComplete.cmd and PartnerSetupComplete.cmd decribed in CVE-2019-1378

item.title: Service Execution
item.description: Detects manual service execution (start) via system utilities

item.title: HH.exe Execution
item.description: Identifies usage of hh.exe executing recently modified .chm files.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.exe
item.description: Execute C# code located in the consoleapp folder

item.title: Possible App Whitelisting Bypass via WinDbg/CDB as a Shellcode Runner
item.description: Launch 64-bit shellcode from a debugger script file using cdb.exe.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Bginfo
item.description: Execute VBscript code that is referenced within the *.bgi file.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dxcap.exe
item.description: Detects execution of of Dxcap.exe

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via DLL Loaded by odbcconf.exe
item.description: Detects defence evasion attempt via odbcconf.exe execution to load DLL

item.title: Regsvr32 Network Activity
item.description: Detects network connections and DNS queries initiated by Regsvr32.exe

item.title: Dnscat Execution
item.description: Dnscat exfiltration tool execution

item.title: Alternate PowerShell Hosts Pipe
item.description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe

item.title: Non Interactive PowerShell
item.description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at powershell.exe with not explorer.exe as a parent.

item.title: PowerShell Execution
item.description: Detects execution of PowerShell

item.title: Remote PowerShell Session
item.description: Detects remote PowerShell connections by monitoring network outbount connections to ports 5985 or 5986 from not network service account

item.title: Remote PowerShell Session
item.description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions

item.title: Remote PowerShell Sessions
item.description: Detects basic PowerShell Remoting by monitoring for network inbound connections to ports 5985 OR 5986

item.title: WMI Modules Loaded
item.description: Detects non wmiprvse loading WMI modules

item.title: Suspicious HWP Sub Processes
item.description: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation

item.title: Windows PowerShell Web Request
item.description: Detects the use of various web request methods (including aliases) via Windows PowerShell

item.title: Devtoolslauncher.exe Executes Specified Binary
item.description: The Devtoolslauncher.exe executes other binary

item.title: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary
item.description: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary

item.title: Suspicious Call by Ordinal
item.description: Detects suspicious calls of DLLs in rundll32.dll exports by ordinal

item.title: DLL Load via LSASS
item.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key

item.title: Emotet Process Creation
item.description: Detects all Emotet like process executions that are not covered by the more generic rules

item.title: Control Panel Items
item.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

item.title: Encoded FromBase64String
item.description: Detects a base64 encoded FromBase64String keyword in a process command line

item.title: Encoded IEX
item.description: Detects a base64 encoded IEX command string in a process command line

item.title: Hacktool Ruler
item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.title: Mimikatz through Windows Remote Management
item.description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.

item.title: Malicious Nishang PowerShell Commandlets
item.description: Detects Commandlet names and arguments from the Nishang exploitation framework

item.title: Empire PowerShell Launch Parameters
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell command line parameters used in Empire

item.title: Suspicious Scripting in a WMI Consumer
item.description: Detects suspicious scripting in WMI Event Consumers

item.title: Baby Shark Activity
item.description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware

item.title: Ursnif
item.description: Detects new registry key created by Ursnif malware.

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Keywords
item.description: Detects keywords that could indicate the use of some PowerShell exploitation framework

item.title: iOS Implant URL Pattern
item.description: Detects URL pattern used by iOS Implant

item.title: Adwind RAT / JRAT
item.description: Detects javaw.exe in AppData folder as used by Adwind / JRAT

item.title: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
item.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: Droppers Exploiting CVE-2017-11882
item.description: Detects exploits that use CVE-2017-11882 to start EQNEDT32.EXE and other sub processes like mshta.exe

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2017-0261
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process FLTLDR.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2017-0261 and CVE-2017-0262

item.title: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines
item.description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines

item.title: Microsoft Office Product Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a Windows command and scripting interpreter executable started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher and Visio

item.title: Microsoft Workflow Compiler
item.description: Detects invocation of Microsoft Workflow Compiler, which may permit the execution of arbitrary unsigned code.

item.title: MSHTA Spwaned by SVCHOST
item.description: Detects MSHTA.EXE spwaned by SVCHOST as seen in LethalHTA and described in report

item.title: NotPetya Ransomware Activity
item.description: Detects NotPetya ransomware activity in which the extracted passwords are passed back to the main module via named pipe, the file system journal of drive C is deleted and windows eventlogs are cleared using wevtutil

item.title: PowerShell Download from URL
item.description: Detects a Powershell process that contains download commands in its command line string

item.title: PowerShell Script Run in AppData
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder

item.title: PsExec Service Start
item.description: Detects a PsExec service start

item.title: Regsvr32 Anomaly
item.description: Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe

item.title: Scheduled Task Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session

item.title: SquiblyTwo
item.description: Detects WMI SquiblyTwo Attack with possible renamed WMI by looking for imphash

item.title: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation Based on Parent Process
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs

item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring

item.title: Suspicious RASdial Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on arguments

item.title: Suspicious WMI Execution
item.description: Detects WMI executing suspicious commands

item.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)

item.title: Windows Shell Spawning Suspicious Program
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Windows shell

item.title: WScript or CScript Dropper
item.description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

item.title: WSF/JSE/JS/VBA/VBE File Execution
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript

item.title: NTFS Alternate Data Stream
item.description: Detects writing data into NTFS alternate data streams from powershell. Needs Script Block Logging.

item.title: CMSTP Execution
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: CMSTP Execution
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: CMSTP Execution
item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.title: PowerShell Rundll32 Remote Thread Creation
item.description: Detects PowerShell remote thread creation in Rundll32.exe

item.title: Default PowerSploit and Empire Schtasks Persistence
item.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.

item.title: smbexec.py Service Installation
item.description: Detects the use of smbexec.py tool by detecting a specific service installation

item.title: Elise Backdoor
item.description: Detects Elise backdoor acitivty as used by APT32

item.title: Suspicious Commands Linux
item.description: Detects relevant commands often related to malware or hacking activity

item.title: Flash Player Update from Suspicious Location
item.description: Detects a flashplayer update from an unofficial location

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2017-8759
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process csc.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2017-8759

item.title: APT29
item.description: This method detects a suspicious powershell command line combination as used by APT29 in a campaign against US think tanks

item.title: ZxShell Malware
item.description: Detects a ZxShell start by the called and well-known function name

item.title: PsExec Tool Execution
item.description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events (service and Sysmon)

item.title: PowerShell Downgrade Attack
item.description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0

item.title: Suspicious Activity in Shell Commands
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various exploit codes (see references)

item.title: Download EXE from Suspicious TLD
item.description: Detects executable downloads from suspicious remote systems

item.title: PowerShell Network Connections
item.description: Detects a Powershell process that opens network connections - check for suspicious target ports and target systems - adjust to your environment (e.g. extend filters with company’s ip range')

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

item.title: Antivirus Exploitation Framework Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework

item.title: Blue Mockingbird
item.description: Attempts to detect system changes made by Blue Mockingbird

item.title: CACTUSTORCH Remote Thread Creation
item.description: Detects remote thread creation from CACTUSTORCH as described in references.

item.title: Covenant Launcher Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers

item.title: CrackMapExec Command Execution
item.description: Detect various execution methods of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

item.title: CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation
item.description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.

item.title: Dllhost Internet Connection
item.description: Detects Dllhost that communicates with public IP addresses

item.title: Download from Suspicious TLD
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts in suspicious TLDs

item.title: Equation Group Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various Equation Group scripts and tools

item.title: Fireball Archer Install
item.description: Detects Archer malware invocation via rundll32

item.title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators
item.description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020

item.title: HTML Help Shell Spawn
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help system when executing compiled HTML files (.chm)

item.title: Impacket Lateralization Detection
item.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

item.title: In-memory PowerShell
item.description: Detects loading of essential DLL used by PowerShell, but not by the process powershell.exe. Detects meterpreter’s “load powershell” extension.

item.title: JexBoss Command Sequence
item.description: Detects suspicious command sequence that JexBoss

item.title: Login with WMI
item.description: Detection of logins performed with WMI

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Commandlet Names
item.description: Detects the creation of known powershell scripts for exploitation

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets
item.description: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Keywords
item.description: Detects keywords from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

item.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Execution
item.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate an execution techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE

item.title: MMC20 Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of “-Embedding” as a child of svchost.exe

item.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher or Visio

item.title: PowerShell Called from an Executable Version Mismatch
item.description: Detects PowerShell called from an executable by the version mismatch method

item.title: PowerShell Credential Prompt
item.description: Detects PowerShell calling a credential prompt

item.title: PowerShell Encoded Character Syntax
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

item.title: PowerShell PSAttack
item.description: Detects the use of PSAttack PowerShell hack tool

item.title: Privilege Escalation Preparation
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands indicating the information gathering phase as preparation for the Privilege Escalation.

item.title: QBot Process Creation
item.description: Detects QBot like process executions

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: Registy Entries For Azorult Malware
item.description: Detects the presence of a registry key created during Azorult execution

item.title: Renamed jusched.exe
item.description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group

item.description: Detects a rundll32 that communicates with public IP addresses

item.description: Detects Trojan loader acitivty as used by APT28

item.title: Squirrel Lolbin
item.description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin

item.title: Suspicious Esentutl Use
item.description: Detects flags often used with the LOLBAS Esentutl for malicious activity. It could be used in rare cases by administrators to access locked files or during maintenance.

item.title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook
item.description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook

item.title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe
item.description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Download
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious Reverse Shell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands or program code that may be exected or used in command line to establish a reverse shell

item.title: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
item.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

item.title: TAIDOOR RAT DLL Load
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Chinese TAIDOOR RAT malware load

item.title: TropicTrooper Campaign November 2018
item.description: Detects TropicTrooper activity, an actor who targeted high-profile organizations in the energy and food and beverage sectors in Asia

item.title: Turla Group Commands May 2020
item.description: Detects commands used by Turla group as reported by ESET in May 2020

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group

item.title: Unidentified Attacker November 2018
item.description: A sigma rule detecting an unidetefied attacker who used phishing emails to target high profile orgs on November 2018. The Actor shares some TTPs with YYTRIUM/APT29 campaign in 2016.

item.title: WMI Spawning Windows PowerShell
item.description: Detects WMI spawning PowerShell

item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript
